content.raw:
Using drcsim 1.3 I get a camera framerate of 24.178 on the rostopic and between 25 and 40 (????) in the Gazebo Image View for Atlas' MultiSense set to 30Hz with 1024x544 resolution.

Using drcsim 2.0 I get a camera framerate of 20.204 on the rostopic and an unknown number in the Gazebo viewer (doesn't show anything for the stereo camera) using the same camera resolution and framerate.

Conclusion: both are (far) below desired framerate and drcsim 2.0 with its synchronized camera only reaches 67% of the desired framerate. I looked into trying to run the threaded_sensors branch but couldn't get it to not segfault when loading Atlas (does it require a specific drcsim branch?).
content.html:
Using drcsim 1.3 I get a camera framerate of 24.178 on the rostopic and between 25 and 40 (????) in the Gazebo Image View for Atlas' MultiSense set to 30Hz with 1024x544 resolution.

Using drcsim 2.0 I get a camera framerate of 20.204 on the rostopic and an unknown number in the Gazebo viewer (doesn't show anything for the stereo camera) using the same camera resolution and framerate.

Conclusion: both are (far) below desired framerate and drcsim 2.0 with its synchronized camera only reaches 67% of the desired framerate. I looked into trying to run the threaded_sensors branch but couldn't get it to not segfault when loading Atlas (does it require a specific drcsim branch?).
